III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
1

rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was placed at Vista Maria Home for Girls. It's believed
she is no longer there. On an unknown date between July and
November 2024 a staff person known as Staff 1 touched Youth
A's private parts. This incident would have occurred between
7/23/2024 and 11/18/2024. Staff 1 was in the laundry room with
Youth A. Youth A and Staff 1 were both fully clothed. Staff 1 used
his hand to touch Youth A's private parts. The private parts that
were touched are used for peeing. Youth A was reported to have
been dating Staff 1 at the time this occurred.
Staff 1 also made inappropriate comments to another youth Lakira
Norman youth B, asking her if she had a boyfriend, if she had
already lost her virginity, how it felt to lose her virginity and if she
liked Staff 1. Lakira youth B slapped Staff 1 when he asked these
things and was written up for it. She attempted to tell staff Mr.
Fred Staff 3 about what happened but he didn't listen.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/15/25
along with the MDHHS Worker. The facility consumer right’s
officer also sat in as a support person with permission from staff.
Staff 1 reported that he was never alone with youth A and stated
that he was aware that youth A liked him because other youth
informed him that she stated he was cute. Staff 1 denied being in
an inappropriate relationship with youth A. Staff 1 denied being
alone in the laundry room with any youth and denied being alone
in the laundry room with Youth A at any time. Staff 1 reported that
if a youth needs help with the laundry staff are standing outside
the door in the hallway and will switch places with the youth to put
detergent in but will not be in the room with the youth at the same
time. Staff 1 denied ever touching youth A or any other youth in
any way and specified that he never touched Youth A on top of
her clothing. Staff 1 denied asking Youth A, Youth B or any other
youth any questions about losing their virginity or if they liked him.
Staff 1 denied asking any youth about sex. Staff 1 denied any
knowledge of anything inappropriate between Staff 5 and the
youth. Staff 1 denied any knowledge of youth B slapping a staff
including himself.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/15/25
along with the MDHHS Worker and consumer rights officer. Staff 2
denied any knowledge of any staff having an inappropriate
relationship with any youth or touching any youth inappropriately.
2

Staff 2 denied any knowledge of Staff 1 having been inappropriate
with a youth. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 has never been on the
wing by himself. Staff 2 reported that she has known Staff 1 to
discuss any concerns he has with supervisors and other staff
regarding youth. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 was aware that youth
A thought he was cute so he was careful to not be the only male
on the floor around youth A by asking for staff to come to assist.
Staff 2 denied knowledge of any staff with the same last name as
Staff 1 having been inappropriate with any youth. Staff 2 reported
that she recalled Youth A saying something about liking Staff 1
and due to this Staff 1 made sure to not work on the wing without
another staff present. Staff 2 reported that she has never heard
Staff 1 say anything inappropriate to a youth including anything
about sex or their virginity. Staff 2 reported that Youth A and
Youth B did not get along and could see Youth B wanting to try to
get youth A in trouble.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/15/25
along with the MDHHS Worker and consumer rights officer. Staff 3
reported that he did not recall any incident involving Staff 1 or any
other staff with Youth A, Youth B or any other youth having a
relationship or inappropriate comments said to a youth about their
virginity or sex. Staff 3 denied any knowledge of an incident with
Youth B slapping any staff. Staff 3 denied any youth reporting any
concerns to him regarding Staff 1, Staff 5, or any other staff being
inappropriate by touching a youth on the butt or making comments
about virginity or sex. Staff 3 denied any knowledge of a youth
slapping Staff 1 or Staff 5. Staff 3 reported that he was aware of
youth A having feelings for Staff 1 and that due to this Staff 1 was
careful to make sure he was working in other areas and not alone
on the wing without other staff.
Complainant was contacted on 1/15/25 via phone and did not
have any additional information.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face on 1/24/25 along with the
MDHHS Worker. Youth C denied any knowledge of any youth
having a relationship with any staff. Youth C reported that she
knew Staff 1 and denied that Staff 1 ever made her uncomfortable
and denied witnessing Staff 1 ever be inappropriate or say
anything inappropriate to any youth including about their virginity
or about sex. Youth C reported that Youth E did have a crush on
Staff 1 and she knew this because she would say things like
“that’s my man” about him. Youth C reported that because of this
Staff 1 would keep his distance from youth E.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/24/25
along with the MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported that no staff at
3

Vista Maria make her feel unsafe or uncomfortable. Youth D
denied any knowledge of any staff making any youth feel
uncomfortable by asking about sex, about virginity, or touching
any youth inappropriately. Youth D reported that she knows a
staff with the name that Staff 1 and Staff 5 share and that she
knows Staff 1 and no one else with that same last name. Youth D
reported that she likes Staff 1 and that he is funny and that he
gives fist bumps and listens to the youth when they are upset.
Youth D denied that a staff would be in the laundry room alone
with a youth at any time, elaborating that the laundry room is small
and the door is held open by the staff standing in the hallway while
the youth do their laundry. Youth D reported that if a youth needs
help they will switch places. Youth D reported that youth
sometimes say things about staff when they are trying to get them
in trouble.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/24/25
along with the MDHHS Worker. Youth E denied any knowledge or
witnessing of any staff doing anything inappropriate with youth
including talking about sex or virginity and including touching any
youth. Youth E reported that she knows one staff with the name
that Staff 1 and Staff 5 share and clarified it is Staff 1 who she
knows. Youth E reported that Staff 1 was “not like that” and
elaborated that he would not do anything wrong. Youth E reported
that she thinks youth make up things about staff to get them in
trouble.
Youth A was forensically interviewed at a child advocacy center
as observed by the consultant along with the MDHHS Worker on
2/12/25. Youth A denied having been touched on her private parts
while at Vista Maria. Youth A reported that staff at Vista Maria
were cool and that she did not have any problems with staff at
Vista Maria. Youth A reported that she felt safe at Vista Maria.
Youth A reported that she got along fine with the other youth at
Vista Maria except for Youth E.
Youth B had an attempted forensic interview at a child advocacy
center as observed by the consultant on 2/12/25. Youth B was
observed sitting with the interviewer and advised that she no
longer wanted to participate and was escorted out.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face on 2/12/25 along with the
MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported that youth B had mentioned the
name belonging to Staff 1 and Staff 5 but did not say anything
specific to her regarding him, only that she did not like him. Staff 4
reported that youth B has not disclosed any inappropriate
behavior exhibited towards her or anyone else by any staff while
4

at Vista Maria. Staff 4 reported that she did not have knowledge of
youth B having any conflict with other youth while at Vista Maria.
Documents reviewed:
• Email dated 1/16/25 from Staff 6 at Vista Maria detailed the
Human Resources record for Staff 1. The record details 5
notes to file regarding attendance including termination due
to attendance on 1/15/25. No other concerns were noted.
• Email dated 2/27/25 from Staff 6 at Vista Maria detailed the
Human Resources record of Staff 5. Staff 5 had 0
disciplinary measures on file. Staff 5 reportedly was
terminated due to an improper restraint on 12/20/2024.
• There were no reported incidents with either Staff 1 or Staff
5 with youth A or youth B including any incidences of youth
A slapping a staff.
Analysis A violation is not established regarding the allegation. It was
denied in interviews with all staff and youth that they had
knowledge of any staff discussing virginity or sex with any youth. It
was consistently denied by all staff and youth that any staff had
touched any youth inappropriately with specific denial of any staff
with the same name of Staff 1 or Staff 5 had touched or said
inappropriate things to any youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
